segments.text: Okay, day one of the Alps trip. Just arrived at the campsite - 1847 meters elevation. Beautiful morning.
Temperature's about 2 degrees Celsius. There's snow on the ground but not too deep. Maybe 15 centimeters.
Let me get the tent set up first. Finding a flat spot... here, this looks good. Ground's a bit frozen but I can get the stakes in.
The four-season tent was the right choice. Wind's picking up a bit from the north.
Alright, tent body is up. Now the rainfly... and stake it down tight. Don't want this blowing away in the night.
Perfect. Now let me organize my gear. Sleeping bag rated to minus 15, check. Sleeping pad, check.
Food bag goes in the bear-resistant container. Even though bears are rare up here, better safe than sorry.
Water situation - there's a stream about 50 meters down. I'll need to filter and boil everything.
Let me fire up the camp stove and make some coffee. Been hiking since 5 AM to get here, I need caffeine.
[sound of stove lighting] There we go. While that heats up, let me check my navigation.
GPS shows I'm right where I planned. Trail to the summit starts about 200 meters west of here.
Forecast looks decent for the next three days. Some snow possible Wednesday, but nothing severe.
I'm planning to do a day hike today up to about 2400 meters, then back here to sleep. Get acclimated to the altitude.
The view from here is incredible. I can see three peaks from camp. This is why I love solo trips.
Just me, the mountains, and silence. No city noise, no phone pinging, just... peace.

environment.background_sounds: wind, stream flowing nearby, tent fabric rustling, stove hissing
